[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Resource: Memory] Can an attacker create ExecutionWaitRequest with futures that allocate unbounded memory during execution, causing validator nodes to OOM crash? (High)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Resource: CPU] Can execution futures consume excessive CPU in tight loops, causing ExecutionWaitPhase's process() to starve other consensus tasks? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Resource: File descriptors] Can execution futures open excessive file handles or network connections, causing resource exhaustion on validator nodes? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Resource: Task spawning] Can the execution future recursively spawn unbounded tokio tasks, overwhelming the runtime and causing validator crashes? (High)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Determinism: Execution results] Does ExecutionWaitPhase guarantee that all validators receive identical ExecutionResponse for the same block, or can timing differences cause divergence? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Determinism: Error handling] Are ExecutorError variants handled deterministically across validators, or can different error states cause consensus forks? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Determinism: Async timing] Can await timing variations in process() cause different validators to process blocks in different orders, breaking consensus safety? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Determinism: Future ordering] If multiple futures complete simultaneously, is there deterministic ordering of ExecutionResponse messages or can race conditions cause state divergence? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Byzantine: Future substitution] Can a Byzantine validator running modified code substitute the execution future with one that returns arbitrary StateComputeResult values? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Byzantine: Selective delays] Can a Byzantine validator selectively delay ExecutionResponse for certain blocks to manipulate consensus timing and cause safety violations? (High)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Byzantine: Error injection] Can Byzantine validators inject fake ExecutorError responses to cause honest validators to reject valid blocks, reducing liveness? (High)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Byzantine: Block ID manipulation] Can a Byzantine validator return ExecutionResponse with manipulated block_id to cause confusion in BufferManager's block tracking? (High)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Timing: Execution duration] If execution takes longer than expected, can this cause timeout mechanisms elsewhere in consensus to trigger incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Timing: Round progression] Can slow execution in ExecutionWaitPhase cause validators to fall behind in rounds, leading to loss of quorum and liveness failure? (High)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Timing: Back pressure] Does ExecutionWaitPhase implement back pressure when execution is slow, or can it cause unbounded queuing in upstream phases? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Timing: Starvation] Can high-priority blocks starve low-priority blocks in ExecutionWaitPhase, causing some blocks to never complete execution? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Race: Multiple awaits] Can the same ExecutionFut be awaited by multiple process() calls concurrently, causing double-execution or undefined behavior? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Race: Response handling] Can ExecutionResponse messages race with reset operations, causing responses to be processed for already-discarded blocks? (High)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Race: Block state] Can races between ExecutionWaitPhase returning results and BufferManager updating block state cause lost updates or state corruption? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Race: Channel closure] If execution_wait_phase_tx channel is closed while process() is running, can this cause panics or lost responses? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Execution: Block-STM] Does ExecutionWaitPhase properly handle Block-STM parallel execution results, or can transaction reordering cause non-deterministic state roots? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Execution: Gas metering] Can gas calculation differences in parallel execution cause ExecutionWaitPhase to return inconsistent results across validators? (High)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Execution: State snapshots] If execution uses stale state snapshots, can ExecutionWaitPhase return results based on incorrect parent state? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Execution: Transaction abort] If some transactions abort during execution, does ExecutionWaitPhase properly handle partial execution results? (High)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_wait_phase.rs] [Debug: ExecutionWaitRequest] Can the Debug implementation for ExecutionWaitRequest leak sensitive information through logs that could aid attackers? (Low)
